sample_rows.Message:
it seems that this paper figures out how to do 1dconv
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/343599175_Real-Time_Sign_Language_Detection_using_Human_Pose_Estimation

  • keep the NaN values
  • perform 1dconv
  • if conv ouput contains NaN, set to zero

sample_rows.Message:
Hi @javohirtoshqorgonov and @jodiaarnold, I also like python very much.

When I got into data science, I had to chose which language to code in and after some research I chose Python.

I had no coding experience, and preferred Python due to :

  • It looking like relatively readable language,
  • Its versatility : I like that it can be used beyond DA/DS also, like for machine learning, webscraping, but also coding small programs easily etc,
  • Very widely documented, a lot of libraries available, a big community for support,…
sample_rows.RawMarkdown:
Hi @javohirtoshqorgonov and @jodiaarnold, I also like python very much.

When I got into data science, I had to chose which language to code in and after some research I chose Python.

I had no coding experience, and preferred Python due to :
- It looking like relatively readable language,
- Its versatility : I like that it can be used beyond DA/DS also, like for machine learning, webscraping, but also coding small programs easily etc,
- Very widely documented, a lot of libraries available, a big community for support,...
